result.execSummary:
The defendant Breanna Nicole Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 3 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,700.00 to be paid to Target as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with Target on West Sunset Drive in Waukesha.
Not be convicted of any other criminal or forfeiture offenses in the next year.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breanna Nicole Price

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order Extending Probation signed and filed. Probation extended for 1 additional year until 02/01/2018 due to unpaid financial obligations.
Fild by DOC on 12/22/16. Filed with proposed order extending probation for unpaid court obligations

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date: 02/01/17
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Breanna Nicole Price in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. State objects to expunction.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 3 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Target on West Sunset Drive in Waukesha.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances;
Not be convicted of any other criminal or forfeiture offenses in the next year.  
Restitution: $1700.00 to be paid to Target as a condition of probation. 
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: Waived   
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Breanna Nicole Price in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant not be employed in any position where she has access to the cash of the employers.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any Target Store.

Defendant Breanna Nicole Price in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Adam Schleis appears as friend of the court.Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
